params.name: lineItems
params.doc: List of line items in the cart/checkout.

params.name: triggers

params.name: purchaseFlowId
params.doc: Persistent ID that correlates between the various eCommerce elements: cart, checkout, and order.

docs.summary:
Retrieves eligible custom discount triggers based on the provided items.

This function is automatically called by Wix eCommerce to retrieve the custom discount triggers provided by your extension.
This happens when actions are performed on the cart/checkout entities/pages. For example, when an item is added to the cart.

> You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by
> an app and can have an arbitrary URL. Therefore, ignore the **Authorization**
> and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Get eligible custom triggers - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary:
Lists all custom triggers provided by your SPI integration.

This function is automatically called by Wix eCommerce to populate the custom [minimum requirements section of an automatic discount](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-creating-automatic-discounts#:~:text=Create%20minimum%20requirements).

> You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by
> an app and can have an arbitrary URL. Therefore, ignore the **Authorization**
> and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: List custom triggers - decoded JWT
body:
curl -X POST https://provider.example.com/v1/listTriggers \
    -H 'user-agent: Wix' \
    -H 'accept-encoding: gzip, deflate' \
    -H 'content-type: text/plain; charset=utf-8'

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary: Used for grouping line items. Sent when an item is added to a cart, checkout, or order.

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within the catalog it belongs to.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app providing the catalog.

You can get your app's ID from its page in the [Wix Dev Center](https://dev.wix.com/apps).

For items from Wix catalogs, the following values always apply:
+ Wix Stores: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`
+ Wix Bookings: `"13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97"`
+ Wix Restaurants: `"9a5d83fd-8570-482e-81ab-cfa88942ee60"`

members.name: options
members.doc:
Additional item details in key:value pairs.

 Use this optional field to specify a variant of the item or add custom details. There are several ways to use `options`:
 + Pass specific information about the item variant in this field. For example, size and color of an item of clothing: `"options": {"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}`.
 + Create a separate API for creating item variants that stores the details and generates a unique ID for each item variant. Then pass only the variant ID in this field. For example: `"options": {"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}`.

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Item quantity in this line item.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc:
Catalog and item reference. Holds IDs for the item and the catalog it came from, as well as further optional info.
 This field is empty in the case of a custom line item.

members.name: name
members.doc: Custom trigger name to display in the dashboard.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc: List of line items in the cart/checkout.

members.name: triggers
members.doc: List of triggers to be checked for discount eligibility.

members.name: purchaseFlowId
members.doc: Persistent ID that correlates between the various eCommerce elements: cart, checkout, and order.

members.name: eligibleTriggers
members.doc: List of eligible triggers. These are used by the Discount Rules API and Wix eCommerce to apply the relevant discount.

members.name: customTriggerId
members.doc: Custom trigger ID. Must be passed with relevant `identifier`.

members.name: identifier
members.doc: Unique trigger identifier. The value must be the same as its equivalent in `triggers[i].identifier` in the request payload.

members.name: identifier
members.doc: Unique trigger identifier. The same value must be returned in `eligibleTriggers[i].identifier`.
